body:
At Myer we pride ourselves on presenting our products impeccably! We iron, we steam, we hang and we fold expertly again and again so a  customer feels like they’re the first to try a garment on!

  

But not all apparel is packaged and presented equally. Business shirts are packed to preserve their collar shape and require special skills to present them as new after they have been taken out of the package.


Ever wondered how to get them back in the package looking new?


We will show you how.
title: Text Title

_items.body: This is one of three 'stays'. When placed under the collar, they help to keep its shape.
_items.title: Cardboard collar stay

_items.body: This is the inside collar stay, the second 'stay'. It gives the collar structure when placed inside it.
_items.title: Inside collar stay

_items.body: This small card is the 'cut talker'. It reveals the shirt shape/cut to our customer.
_items.title: Cut talker

_items.body: These plastic clips have interlocking teeth to hold on the folds together.
_items.title: Clips

_items.body: This is the butterfly clip. One of its sides is slightly raised to help you place it and adjust the tension of your folds.
_items.title: Butterfly clip

_items.body: This is the front collar stay, the last of the 'stays'. It supports the collar's front.
_items.title: Front collar stay

_items.body: This is the cardboard base, it has a top T- shaped notch and a bottom triangular notch. It will guide your main shirt folds .
_items.title: Folding board

_items.body: This is the shirt bag. It's the final touch to perfectly present shirts in display.
_items.title: Shirt bag

body: Up to 8 tools are the secret behind those crisply packaged business shirts - some brands might use less but the principles remain. Select each number to learn what they're called and what they do.
title: Hot Graphic Title

body:
Start by checking the shirt is buttoned up.
Then on a flat clean surface, lay the shirt facing down. 

Place the inside collar stay underneath the collar with the score at the base.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: STEP 1: Position the inside collar stay

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

displayTitle: Step 2: Fix the cardboard folding board
body:
Now use the T-shaped notch in the cardboard folding board to secure it to the cardboard collar stay. This will keep the inside collar stay and this board in place whilst you fold.


Then centre the cardboard folding board by aligning the triangular notch at its base with the shirt’s button underneath.
title: Step 2: Fix the cardboard folding board

body:
Use the cardboard folding board edge to guide the first fold lengthwise. If the shirt still has the factory creases follow these.


Fold the sleeve with the cuff’s seams lined up with the outside of the cardboard so that the cuff can be folded to the front of the shirt to display the sleeve talker. Then fold lengthwise again placing the excess fabric under.


Repeat the same lengthwise folds for the other side.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: STEP 3: Start folding!

body:
Time to secure the folds you have just done. First create a tight fit of the shirt around the cardboard by pulling the two folded sides.
Secure them using a butterfly clip.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: STEP 4: Feel the tension

displayTitle: Step 5: Keep it tight and fold the sleeve
body:
With the top of the shirt wrapped around the cardboard securely, fold  any excess material along the folds using the factory creases as a guide.
Fold the remaining sleeve up the middle of the back.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: STEP 5: Keep it tight and fold the sleeve

body:
Fold up the bottom edge of the shirt against the edge of the cardboard, it’s key you pull it slightly to ensure the shirt is wrapped tightly.
At this point you will notice your folds make the width of the shirt narrower towards the hem which allows you to tuck it in between the cardboard and the butterfly-clipped shoulders.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: STEP 6: Tuck away the hem

body:
Keep the shirt’s hem tucked away using a clip on each side at the back. Then secure the cuff with a clip at the front of the shirt, hiding against the cuff button.

 
Ensure you are displaying the shirt information at the front.


Now place the inside and front collar stays to protect the structure of the collar in case shirts are piled up in display.
Start with the inside collar stay. This stay is adjustable so it can fit several collar sizes.

The front collar stay is the final touch to keep the collar lifted: its middle slot is placed around the shirt’s collar button.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: Step7_Display-proof the shirt

displayTitle: Step 8: Into the bag, out to the shelf
body: The last step is to insert the shirt, collar first, into the bag. The bag has a pleated end that gives enough room for the collar and an adhesive seal which closes the bag at the back.

_audio.ariaLabel: This button will play an audio description of the video

_media.ariaLabel: This button will play the video

title: Step8_Into the bag out to the shelf

body:
Many of our stores have business shirts sitting in reserves as dead stock because they are unpackaged - up to 500 in some. 

With your help these shirts can be displayed again for our customers in store or online. 


You can find time to fold when you're helping in our fitting rooms. And whilst you're there keep an eye out for all packaging removed by customers trying a shirt on: don't throw packaging so you can return unsold tried-on shirts to their former crisp glory!  


The more shirts you return to the fold by keeping on top of unpackaged shirts, the less there will be in reserves and the more your store can replenish with the latest designs.
title: Text and Graphic Title

_incorrect.final:
Not quite. 


Revisit the steps and videos till you feel sure of the steps and can repackage shirts like a pro!

_partlyCorrect.final:
Almost.


Revisit the steps and videos and practice till you can repackage shirts like a pro!

_feedback.correct:
Nailed it.   

Get practising and further develop your dexterity at repackaging shirts.

body:
Let's test you can organise the steps to repackage a shirt.


For each step select the correct answer.
title: Matching Title

body:
Learning how to repackage a shirt is a valuable skill that helps everyone:


· You who can add a new skill to your list!

· Customers find an impeccably presented product 

· Our online fulfilment colleagues can get the shirts for online customers

· Your store who can sell and replenish the latest shirts.

And in case you need more packaging accessories, contact the Buying office.


So keep on folding!
title: Text and Graphic Title
